He was a good professor. There's a few quizzes, sometimes he will hint at them sometimes he won't. I didn't really read the textbook. The study guides were helpful. He's sarcastic it's funny. You'll have to watch films in this class, but they're interesting.

This teacher is not good, this teacher is great. You will pass this class easy, if you study, that will be an easy A. He gave study guide, and quizz in class. you do not need the book, but make sure you come to class. Best history teacher I have took.

he's a good professor. very passionate and also funny. there are three tests and one final but he drops the lowest grade. test arent difficult if you study and know the material. take good notes and read the book. there are 5 pop quizzes which are easy if you pay attention and he also drops lowest one as well. one short paper. pretty easy class.

i did the bare minimum in this class and managed to get a C. If i would've just slightly put some effort it's definitely an easy B or A class. He gives study guides for each test telling exactly what you should be studying for and I would teach myself the night before tests. 6 pop quizzes for attendance check
the tests are easy. he puts the test on a studyguide for each one. go to class .cause he gives pop quizzes.

Why the poor comments? He's so nice & funny. Gives study guides for every test. If you do the study guides, the tests should be an easy Ahigh B. One short, easy paper. DON'T NEED BOOK, I rarely used it. Go to class, sometimes there are pop quizzes. Uses power points, bring your laptop & type in his commentary and you will pass w a good grade.

Hard class. Have to read many chapters and doesn't tell which chapter that would be used for the quiz. Tests are hard and study guides are hard. Must pay attention in class and attend class regularly. Would not take him again. No extra credit but does drop one quiz and test grade. other assignments none just one paper. Good luck!

I disagree with the comment below. Yeah he makes you work for it- but hey its college, not HS. you're here to learn & prof. valenzuela makes you think outside the box. those pop quizzes will getchya though-so def. prep b4 class. i'd take him again. im walking away w knowledge, not just a grade.

I honestly think this guy gave his own recommendations on rmp. Not easy to follow during lectures. Literally need to read all chapters pre class To pass matching pop quizzes. Dry humor. You definitely. Have to work for a passing Grade. Won't let you see old tests for cumulative final either. Do able but not an easy a.

Professor Valenzuela is awesome! He does power points and posts them online. You rarely use the text book, but I found it helpful to use when filling out the study guides. No attendance policy but there are six pop quizzes through out the semester. He lets you drop one test grade and one quiz grade. Great teacher and you can tell he's passionate.

Great professor! Classes are slightly boring, but if you pay attention and take notes, there should be no reason for not getting an A. He lets you drop one test, and a quiz. The book is more or less helpful depending on your learning style. Good guy, I'd take his class again.

Overall a great professor. If you pay attention in class it's fairly simple material to absorb. He has no attendance policy but does give out quizzes every now and then. He drops the lowest test and quiz grade so if you do well in the class you will not have to take the final. I would take him over again if i had to.
Exams are easy and he gives you a pretty specific study guide about a week beforehand. Easy to understand, overall great professor. I'd take him again.
Great teacher.  Test are fairly easy if you read the book and study for them.  He posts study guides to tell you what to know for the test.  I would definitely take him again.

Professor Valenzuela is a great professor! Very passionate about what he is teaching. His tests are easy if you just read the text and study the power points, but you have to study! He is extremely fair and pleasant to deal with. He made a field that always bored me very interesting!

Great Professor! Extremely clear about what he expects Read the chapters in the book and you will do well on exams Lectures can be some what boring..but it is history Optional Final 3 exams, 5 reading pop quizzes, 1 paper over a documentary film you watch in class. Notes posted online & study guide but I didn't find it helpful. Would take him again

Mr. V is a great professor. He is incredibly helpful and pretty flexible. His class is pretty simple, 4 test, a few pop quizzes and a very easy perspective paper. He drops the lowest test score and lowest quiz grade. HIGHLY recommend.

Absolutely wonderful professor. He is very enthusiastic about what he is teaching and really wants his students to succeed. There are three test and a final but he drops the lowest. He also gives five random pop quizzes to encourage students to show up to class for 10% of your grade. I missed a few and still did well. Highly recommended!

There was 3 tests and the final was optional if you wanted to take it. Also, 3 papers, but they were just a page and a reflective paper. Very easy! The first test was not easy for me, but the last 3 test were easy! I took the final & made an 106! You have to put effort in, but you will be ok. Very good teacher! Class is not mandatory.
Even though class is mandatory I recommend that you go to class! Read the point and go over his power points for the class and you should be okay. It is a lot of reading though.

Very passionate guy and I fully appreciate that. He teaches the REAL history that they didn't teach you in high school. I hope that KSU gives him a full time gig because he deserves it. Drops the lowest test grade so there's only 3 grades for the whole class. Keep up with the readings and you'll be fine (he picked a great book, so it will be easy)

He is the sweetest professor ever when you ask for extra help!  You never use the book except for an extra credit assignment at the end.  Attendance not mandatory, all ppts online and the material really is interesting stuff if you care about history.  I would take him again and recommend everyone to him. Drops lowest test grade.

Professor Valenzuela genuinely wants his students to do well.  His lectures are kinda boring because all he does is read from Powerpoints but he will throw in a joke.  There are 4 tests and the lowest grade is dropped.  So if you do well on the first 3 you don't have to take the final.  Class is not mandatory but he tries to reward attendance.

This is one of the nicest people I have encountered, ever. He responds very quickly to emails, very attentive, and will answer any questions you may have. He is funny and charming, and the tests are reasonable. He doesn't have mandatory attendance, but trust me you're going to actually want to go to class. I think anyone can enjoy this man.

He really loves history and knows what he is talking about! He is helpful and approachable even during tests. He does a good job at working with the class and is not against changing the way he does things to accomidate. I don't even like history and I liked this class!

He is an extremely nice man if you ever need any extra help from him. He doesn't require attendance and doesn't use a book, all powerpoints go online. The studyguides are sorta useless, just READ the 100 slide powerpoints and it really helps. He drops the lowest test and always puts extra credit essays at the end of them. Extra cred assignment too!

Very nice prof and fairly easy so long as you take notes and pay attention. Grade is based on 4 tests, with ability to drop 1 with the final. Tests are mix of multiple choice, identification, essay, and small bonus essays for 5-10 points. Book is definitely not needed or used, except maybe once for small group activity.

Best professor I've had at Kennesaw, smart, funny, and he knows his stuff. If you get a chance to take a course of his, TAKE IT. His grades were 4 tests, and you were allowed to drop the lowest one. He makes the content extremely interesting with his humor and with his extensive knowledge.
Prof Valenzuela is a very good teacher, and the class is fairly easy if you read and pay attention in class.  Teaches from a very liberal viewpoint, if that matters to you.
He gives good information on the things he teaches. Study the book and his powerpoints and you'll do fine.

Tests are extremely easy if u pay attention to the lectures and read over the chapters in the book. He doesnt take attendance, but go to class to get the lectures. He posts study guides that dont really help, but there is extra credit on each test that you just barely have to attempt. Dropped lowest test grade. I never really studied and got an A.
His tests are pretty easy. Multiple choice, 5 identifications, extra credit essay on test. He is also an easy grader for the EC essay. Does not take attendance, and is very nice.
